title: Solana RPC 403: ankr.com/solana blocked, circuit breaker cycling endlessly
description:
attached_molecule: cy-wisp-oy6j
attached_at: 2026-02-20T19:30:22Z
attached_args: SKIP PLAN MODE. Implement directly. Solana RPC at rpc.ankr.com/solana returns 403 (free tier blocked). Circuit breaker cycles CLOSED→OPEN→HALF_OPEN→OPEN endlessly, flooding console. Fix: update the Solana RPC endpoint config to use a working provider (e.g. Helius, QuickNode, or Alchemy with API key, or a different free endpoint). Also investigate and fix the 'Module util has been externalized for browser compatibility' warnings — sol-integration is importing Node.js util.debuglog and util.inspect which don't work in browser.
dispatched_by: mayor

User reports console flooded with 403s from rpc.ankr.com/solana. Circuit breaker cycles CLOSED→OPEN→HALF_OPEN→OPEN on repeat. Also: 'Module util has been externalized for browser compatibility' warnings from sol-integration using Node.js util module in browser context. The Solana RPC endpoint needs replacing or an API key. The util.debuglog/util.inspect imports in sol-integration need browser-compatible alternatives.

title: Phase 2: Config bootstrap with decentralized-first RPC defaults
description:
Phase 2 of en-tfkn (Decentralized RPC Provider Strategy). Update CygnusWealthApp config bootstrap.

MODIFY buildRpcProviderConfig(env, userConfig?):
- POKT F-Chains as primary for all chains (keyless, no env var needed)
- dRPC as secondary, Lava Network as tertiary
- Alchemy/Helius/Infura demoted to fallback
- Accept optional UserRpcConfig for user overrides (prepend or override mode)
- Keyless-only default mode — app works on first launch without any configuration
- User endpoint storage/retrieval from encrypted IndexedDB
- Endpoint validation: URL format, health check, chain ID verification, latency measurement

Per-chain configs per en-tfkn Section 4 tables. Solana dual-path: Helius for DAS API, POKT for standard RPC.

DEPENDS ON Phase 1 (da- types).

Reference: EnterpriseArch mayor/rig/en-tfkn-decentralized-rpc-provider-strategy.md sections 4, 5, 6. Follow TDD.
close_reason: Restructured per en-1mg1 — imports change to rpc-infrastructure

title: Add browser cache and loading spinners for dashboard assets
description:
attached_molecule: cy-wisp-x72g
attached_at: 2026-02-17T19:21:25Z
attached_args: SKIP PLAN MODE. Implement directly. Add browser caching (localStorage or similar) for portfolio data so the dashboard shows cached assets immediately on load. Add Chakra UI loading spinners/skeletons to the asset table while data is being fetched. Use Zustand persist middleware if appropriate. Do NOT run E2E tests locally — only build + unit tests. Do NOT use EnterPlanMode.
dispatched_by: mayor

User reports: Assets take a very long time to appear in the dashboard table. Two fixes needed: (1) Implement browser-side caching (e.g. localStorage or IndexedDB) so previously-loaded portfolio data shows immediately on page load while fresh data fetches in background. (2) Add loading spinners/skeleton UI to the asset table and any other areas that wait on async data. The user should never see a blank table — show cached data first, then a subtle refresh indicator while updating. Tech: React 19, Zustand, Chakra UI v3. Keep it simple.

title: Dashboard asset loading extremely slow — long delay before portfolio values appear
description: User reports extremely long wait time before tokens and USD values start appearing on the dashboard. Likely related to: (1) Solana RPC 403s causing timeouts before circuit breaker opens, (2) EVM token discovery issues where most tokens aren't found, (3) sequential rather than parallel chain fetching. Console shows useAccountSync fetching across 7 EVM chains sequentially plus Solana. BSC and Avalanche are skipped (no chain config) but may still add latency. The sync-already-in-progress guard suggests double-triggering.

attached_molecule: cy-wisp-3kp
attached_at: 2026-02-14T14:38:09Z
attached_args: SKIP PLAN MODE. Implement directly.

Add testnet support to CygnusWealthApp. 1) Create src/config/environment.ts — reads VITE_NETWORK_ENV, detects CI env var, defaults to testnet in CI. 2) Create src/config/integration-factory.ts — central factory injecting environment into all integrations. 3) Create src/components/EnvironmentIndicator.tsx — visible badge (yellow=testnet, red=production, green=local), non-dismissible in non-production. 4) Zustand persistence keys namespaced by environment. 5) Playwright E2E setup forces VITE_NETWORK_ENV=testnet, validates testnet RPCs, seeds test wallets. 6) Core E2E specs: wallet-connect, portfolio-sync, ci-safety-gate. NOTE: This rig has 98 TS build errors (Chakra UI v3 migration debt) that must be resolved first.

title: Fix console errors and missing tokens on dashboard
description:
attached_molecule: cy-wisp-q00w
attached_at: 2026-02-17T19:24:52Z
attached_args: SKIP PLAN MODE. Investigate directly. The CygnusWealthApp dashboard only shows ETH on Ethereum and ETH on Arbitrum for wallet 0x08ff8b099dcc50e212c998731b34a548826e1969, which has many more tokens. There are also many console errors about getting balances and values. Analyze the data flow across bounded contexts: CygnusWealthApp → PortfolioAggregation → EvmIntegration + AssetValuator. Read the source code of each rig to trace the issue. Determine which bounded context(s) have the root cause. Produce a clear architectural analysis: which rigs need fixes, what each fix should address, and recommended priority order. Do NOT write code — produce analysis only. Do NOT use EnterPlanMode.
dispatched_by: mayor

User reports two related symptoms: (1) LOTS of errors in the browser web console about getting balances and values. (2) Dashboard only shows 2 items — ETH on Ethereum and ETH on Arbitrum — but the connected wallet (0x08ff8b099dcc50e212c998731b34a548826e1969) has many more tokens. These are likely related — errors fetching balances/prices are probably causing tokens to silently fail and not display. Investigate the error sources: could be in how CWA calls evm-integration or asset-valuator, could be bad error handling swallowing failures, could be missing token discovery. Trace the errors, fix what you can in CWA, and report back if root causes are in upstream packages (evm-integration, asset-valuator).
notes: Implemented: Replaced Ethplorer freekey with @cygnus-wealth/evm-integration ChainRegistry for multi-chain ERC20 token discovery. Fixed spam filter to show unpriced tokens with positive balance. Removed simulated loadBalance. Added Base chain support. All 230 tests pass.

title: LiveUpdateStore, useLivePortfolio hook, WS status UI, tab visibility optimization
description:
attached_molecule: cy-wisp-a8g4
attached_at: 2026-02-18T07:46:59Z
attached_args: SKIP PLAN MODE. Implement directly. LiveUpdateStore and WebSocket UI per en-p0ha architecture directive (steps 8-9). (1) LiveUpdateStore Zustand store: subscriptionStatus Map, lastUpdateTimestamp Map, pendingUpdates queue, isLiveMode boolean. Actions: handlePortfolioUpdate updates CacheStore, flushPendingUpdates batches within 100ms window. (2) useLivePortfolio() hook returning { portfolio, subscriptionStatus, isLive, lastUpdated }. (3) Status indicators: green=Live, yellow=Reconnecting, orange=Polling, red=Offline. Per-chain status in settings. (4) Rendering optimization: batch 100ms, selective re-render via Zustand selectors, balance change animations. (5) Tab visibility: close WS after 30s hidden, 60s polling while background, immediate HTTP poll + WS restore on foreground. Mock portfolio-aggregation SubscriptionOrchestrator in tests. Follow TDD. Do NOT use EnterPlanMode. Run unit tests locally, E2E via CI only. Pipe npm install to /tmp/install.log.
dispatched_by: mayor

Implement LiveUpdateStore and WebSocket UI per en-p0ha architecture directive (steps 8-9).

1. LiveUpdateStore (Zustand):
   - State: subscriptionStatus Map<ChainId, status>, lastUpdateTimestamp Map<ChainId, number>, pendingUpdates queue, isLiveMode boolean
   - Actions: handlePortfolioUpdate(event), setSubscriptionStatus(chainId, status), enableLiveMode(), disableLiveMode(), flushPendingUpdates()
   - Integration: handlePortfolioUpdate() updates CacheStore with new asset data, triggers React re-renders via Zustand selectors

2. useLivePortfolio() hook:
   - Subscribes to CacheStore for portfolio data + LiveUpdateStore for connection status
   - Returns: { portfolio, subscriptionStatus, isLive, lastUpdated }

3. UI status indicators:
   - Green dot / 'Live' badge when all chain subscriptions active
   - Yellow dot / 'Reconnecting' when any chain reconnecting
   - Orange dot / 'Polling' when fallen back to HTTP
   - Red dot / 'Offline' when no data source
   - Per-chain status in connection status panel (settings page)

4. Rendering optimization:
   - Batch rendering: collect updates within 100ms window, apply in single React render via flushPendingUpdates()
   - Selective re-render: Zustand selectors so only affected asset components re-render
   - Animation: balance changes animate (highlight or count-up)

5. Tab visibility optimization:
   - On background (document.hidden): close WS after 30s, switch to 60s polling
   - On foreground: immediate HTTP poll, re-establish WS, resume live mode

DEPENDENCY: Requires SubscriptionOrchestrator in portfolio-aggregation and WS services in integrations. Implement against expected interfaces, mock in tests.

Follow TDD. Reference: enterprise-arch mayor/en-p0ha-websocket-first-architecture.md

title: Infinite loop after MetaMask connect on Dashboard
description:
attached_molecule: cy-wisp-3sn
attached_at: 2026-02-14T06:53:16Z
dispatched_by: mayor
notes:
## Bug Description

After connecting a MetaMask wallet and navigating to the Dashboard, the app enters an infinite re-render loop that kills the browser tab.

## Root Cause Analysis (Mayor investigation)

**File:** `src/hooks/useAccountSync.ts`

**Mechanism:** Classic React hooks anti-pattern — unstable array reference in useEffect dependency array.

- Line 97: `const walletAccounts = accounts.filter(...)` creates a NEW array reference on every render
- Line 246: `walletAccounts` is in the useEffect dependency array
- The effect calls `setAssets()` (line 237) which triggers a re-render
- Re-render → new walletAccounts ref → effect fires again → infinite loop

The ref-based guard at line 110 mitigates the async work but does NOT prevent the effect from firing repeatedly.

**Secondary issue:** `src/hooks/useProgressiveAssetLoading.ts` line 287-289 has been TEMPORARILY DISABLED with a comment about "debug performance issue" — likely the same class of bug (unstable array ref in deps at line 311).

## Fix Direction

Wrap the `.filter()` call in `useMemo(() => ..., [accounts])` so walletAccounts has a stable reference. Also audit useProgressiveAssetLoading.ts for the same pattern and re-enable it if the root cause is the same.

## Affected Flow

1. User connects MetaMask via MultiWalletConnect component
2. Navigate to Dashboard (src/components/Dashboard.tsx line 40 calls useAccountSync)
3. Hook enters infinite loop

title: Slow asset loading: long delay before portfolio values appear
description:
attached_molecule: cy-wisp-6m9g
attached_at: 2026-02-17T21:36:36Z
attached_args: SKIP PLAN MODE. Implement directly. User reports slow asset loading after connecting wallets. Investigate useAccountSync.ts: (1) Verify cached values from Zustand persist show immediately on repeat visits. (2) Check if fetches are sequential vs parallel — EVM chains and Solana should fetch concurrently. (3) Check if Solana 403 errors cause long timeout delays that block the whole sync. (4) Add request parallelization and proper timeout handling so one failing chain doesn't block others. (5) Ensure the loading skeleton/spinner from cy-a5uw is visible during fetch. Do NOT use EnterPlanMode. Do NOT run E2E tests locally — only build + unit tests.
dispatched_by: mayor

User reports assets take a very long time to appear after connecting wallets. Despite cy-a5uw adding browser caching and loading spinners (now merged), loading still feels slow. Investigate: (1) Are cached values showing immediately on repeat visits? (2) Is the initial fetch bottleneck in EVM RPC calls, asset valuation, or Solana 403 failures causing timeouts? (3) Are requests being made sequentially instead of in parallel? Profile the data flow from wallet connect through useAccountSync to asset display and identify the bottleneck.

title: Use EvmIntegration for token discovery instead of inline ethplorer
description: ARCHITECTURAL ANALYSIS: useAccountSync.ts makes direct ethplorer API calls (line 197) for ERC20 discovery — ethplorer only supports Ethereum mainnet so tokens on Polygon/Arbitrum/Optimism/Base are invisible. Also creates new AssetValuator() per price call (line 56), wasting cache and hammering APIs. Also, spam filter hides tokens with priceUsd<=0, so failed price lookups cause tokens to disappear. FIX NEEDED: (1) Replace inline ethplorer calls with EvmIntegration's token discovery (once ev- bead above ships). (2) Share single AssetValuator instance across all price calls. (3) Don't hide tokens just because price lookup failed — show them with 'price unavailable' indicator instead of hiding. (4) Add proper error states to the UI for failed fetches. Route through system architect → unit architect → engineer. DEPENDENCY: Depends on EvmIntegration shipping dynamic token discovery first.

title: Phantom + MetaMask conflict: Cannot redefine property ethereum
description: When Phantom wallet extension is installed alongside MetaMask, evmAsk.js throws: Cannot redefine property: ethereum. Both extensions compete to inject window.ethereum. The app should handle multi-provider environments gracefully — use EIP-6963 provider discovery or similar to avoid the property redefinition conflict. Currently this error fires on every page load when both extensions are present.

title: Phase 6: Settings UI for RPC endpoints, privacy controls, provider health
description:
Phase 6 of en-tfkn (Decentralized RPC Provider Strategy). Add settings UI to CygnusWealthApp.

NEW SETTINGS PANELS:
1. Settings → Advanced → RPC Providers:
   - Per-chain endpoint configuration (show current source, allow custom endpoint)
   - Override mode selector: 'Replace all defaults' vs 'Use as primary with defaults as fallback'
   - Health indicator per endpoint (green/yellow/red)
   - Test button for manual health check + latency measurement
   - Reset to defaults button
   - Provider health dashboard showing active/healthy providers per chain

2. Settings → Privacy:
   - Provider rotation toggle (default: enabled)
   - Privacy mode toggle (restrict to decentralized providers only, with UX warning about reduced fallback)
   - Query jitter slider (0-500ms)

3. First-launch experience:
   - App works immediately with keyless POKT defaults
   - Optional prompt to add API keys for enhanced performance

DEPENDS ON Phases 4 and 5 (integration wiring complete).

description:
attached_molecule: cy-wisp-33ri
attached_at: 2026-02-17T23:52:22Z
attached_args: SKIP PLAN MODE. Implement directly. Phase 2 of RPC fallback chain (per en-25w5). Implement buildRpcProviderConfig(env) that reads CYGNUS_RPC_ALCHEMY_KEY, CYGNUS_RPC_DRPC_KEY, CYGNUS_RPC_HELIUS_KEY, CYGNUS_RPC_INFURA_KEY, CYGNUS_RPC_QUICKNODE_KEY from import.meta.env. Construct endpoint URLs per provider URL templates (e.g., https://eth-mainnet.g.alchemy.com/v2/KEY). Assemble complete RpcProviderConfig with per-chain fallback chains per rpc-strategy.md. Graceful degradation: missing keys skip that tier, fall through to public endpoints. Create .env.example documenting all vars. Use RpcProviderConfig types from latest @cygnus-wealth/data-models. Unit tests for all-keys, partial-keys, no-keys modes. Location: src/config/. Follow TDD. Do NOT use EnterPlanMode. Do NOT run E2E tests locally.
dispatched_by: mayor

RPC fallback chain Phase 2 (per en-25w5 directive). Depends on Phase 1 (data-models types).

Implement buildRpcProviderConfig(env) in cygnus-wealth-app:
- Reads CYGNUS_RPC_ALCHEMY_KEY, CYGNUS_RPC_DRPC_KEY, CYGNUS_RPC_HELIUS_KEY, CYGNUS_RPC_INFURA_KEY, CYGNUS_RPC_QUICKNODE_KEY env vars
- Constructs endpoint URLs per provider URL templates
- Assembles complete RpcProviderConfig with per-chain fallback chains
- Graceful degradation: missing API keys skip that provider tier, falls back to public endpoints
- Create .env.example documenting all supported variables
- Unit tests for: all keys present, partial keys, no keys (public-only mode)

Location: src/config/ or src/infrastructure/

title: Missing EVM tokens: only USDC shows, ETH/USDT/WETH/PYUSD missing for 0xbdecc2c147a5647f8074a087afa279755ccbc304
description:
attached_molecule: cy-wisp-mqe4
attached_at: 2026-02-20T19:29:07Z
attached_args: SKIP PLAN MODE. Implement directly. P0 bug: only USDC shows for address 0xbdecc2c147a5647f8074a087afa279755ccbc304 on Ethereum mainnet — ETH (native), USDT, WETH, PYUSD are all missing. Investigate useAccountSync.ts and the evm-integration facade. Check if getBalances returns native ETH, check if getTokens/ERC20 discovery is working for all standard tokens. The user sees fetches for Ethereum, Polygon, BSC, Arbitrum, Optimism, Avalanche, Base but BSC and Avalanche are skipped (no chain config). Fix token discovery so all held tokens appear.
dispatched_by: mayor

User manually testing with address 0xbdecc2c147a5647f8074a087afa279755ccbc304. Wallet holds ETH (native), USDC, USDT, WETH, and PYUSD on Ethereum mainnet. Only USDC is displayed in the dashboard. Native ETH and other ERC-20 tokens are not showing. This is likely a token discovery or balance fetching issue in evm-integration or the app's useAccountSync hook. Also contributes to slow loading — requests may be timing out or returning incomplete data. Console shows fetches happening for Ethereum, Polygon, BSC (skipped — no chain config), Arbitrum, Optimism, Avalanche (skipped — no chain config), Base.
